column4: anyone know if SATA, PCI Express, and Quad processors are compatible with Ubuntu?

Hey guys, I'm using Audicity to modify mp3s and make them into ring tones, but audicity needs a file: libmp3lame.so and i can't find this file on synaptic
Hey guys, I'm using Audicity to modify mp3s and make them into ring tones, but audicity needs a file: libmp3lame.so and i can't find this file on synaptic
try installing lame... sudo apt-get install lame (?) Or use synaptic and search for lame...
so - did it work?
it is almost certainly in /usr/lib
nope... not in there.
dunno :-( Use Synaptic and search for "lame", perhaps it is in a different package to the lame program (seems odd thought) Wait, I'll go look...
sorry, it's the "liblame0" package you need to install. I suggest uninstalling the lame package you just installed, then installing liblame (unless you want the lame converter for other reasons)
and for some reason, audicity still doesn't recognize the file
this is the command I type, autoremove lame ?
sudo apt-get remove lame (assuming "lame" was the package you just installed) then "sudo apt-get install liblame0"
no... that file doesn't work either. Audicity doesn't recognize the new files installed.
liblame0-dev ?
no, "liblame0"
Audicity can't find the file lol
did YOU find the file, or did Audacity find the file?
so did Audacity end up seeing it too or not?
uhm.... Audacity asked for the file, so I had to search it in the "lib" folder, and the libmp3 file was in there
